headline: Toast Brings In Mastercard Veteran As Markets Assess Valuation Risks
summary: Toast (NYSE:TOST) has appointed Rossana Niola as its new Chief Accounting Officer. Niola joins Toast after a leadership tenure at Mastercard. For you as an investor, this is a meaningful development because the Chief Accounting Officer helps shape how a company reports and manages its finances. Toast focuses on software and payments solutions for restaurants, a sector that has seen ongoing interest in digital ordering, payments, and back office tools. A seasoned accounting leader from a...

headline: Your baby could qualify for $1,000 with a 'Trump Account.' Here's what to know
summary: As a continuation of President Donald Trump 's pitch to Americans on affordability and the economy under his administration, the U.S. Treasury and White House are celebrating the upcoming launch of a program they view as a key milestone: “Trump Accounts.”  A provision of Trump's tax legislation, Trump Accounts are meant to give $1,000 to every newborn, so long as their parents open an account.  A U.S. Treasury event Wednesday brings together an assortment of politicians and celebrities — from Texas Republican Sen. Ted Cruz to rapper Nicki Minaj — to discuss the program and its potential impact on the economy.

headline: Dave Ramsey Calls Credit Cards ‘Financial Cigarettes’, and He Has A Point
summary: Dave Ramsey, the personal finance radio host and author, has long compared credit cards to cigarettes, calling them “the cigarette of the financial world” in his 2003 book The Total Money Makeover. His argument: both products are socially acceptable, heavily marketed, and financially destructive over time. With Americans now carrying $1.233 trillion in credit card ... Dave Ramsey Calls Credit Cards ‘Financial Cigarettes’, and He Has A Point

headline: Visa, Mastercard, AmEx earnings: Trump's cap idea 'won't stick'
summary: Credit card companies, like Visa (V), Mastercard (MA), and American Express (AXP), are reporting quarterly earnings results this week.The earnings reports come as President Trump proposes a 10% cap on credit card interest rates. JPMorgan (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon said this policy would create an "economic disaster."B. Riley Wealth chief market strategist, Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma, and Yahoo Finance Senior Business Reporter Ines Ferré join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to discuss their expectations.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.
